str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race. Of Hebrew origin; Abraham, the Hebrew patriarch.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From dikaios; to render just or innocent.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A boasting; a ground of boasting (glorying, exultation). From kauchaomai; a boast in a good or a bad sense.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
